channel.title: Apple on Damien Saunders | Management Marketing Consultant
channel.description: Recent content in Apple on Damien Saunders | Management Marketing Consultant

item.title: Time for a service - #reformated-my-mac-day
item.description: Reformatting a computer is usually an emotionally distressful activity - involving losing files, trying to find software discs and panic about lost licence codes.

item.title: I feel like a kid in a candy shop - #reformatted-my-mac-day
item.description: I woke up this morning .. it's pouring with rain - my Apple MacBook Pro decides it doesn't want to connect to my wifi.

item.title: HOW TO: Start, Stop, Restart or Reload Jenkins - Mac OSx
item.description: I've just started to use Jenkins as part of a continuous integration setup that I'm building.

item.title: WTF! TomTom you make Apple Maps really do suck
item.description: To me, I used Apple Maps on my iPad to check walking directions.

item.title: Why You Don’t Need Mac Anti-Virus Software - Plus What You Do Need
item.description: I've been using Apple Macbook Pro as my primary work horse since 2008.

item.title: 3 articles to read on Brand Marketing - Strategy
item.description: You'll love these 3 articles by Mark Ritson who has a weekly opinion piece in Marketing Week.

item.title: Top Development Tools on my MacBook Pro

item.title: It wasn't about design - it was the first computer I used. Thanks Steve
item.description: What was your first computer? The first computer I had regular use of was kept locked up in my school's library.

item.title: Just Updated - iTunes in the Cloud (beta)
item.description: There's a new update to iTunes this morning (evening in the UK) - iTunes 10.

item.title: Are you thinking what I'm thinking? Two predictions for Steve Jobs?
item.description: Are you thinking what I'm thinking? It's only a few hours til the start of the Apple WWDC which is ‘the biggest’ event in the year for Apple Fans.

item.title: Apple Aperture updates to 3.1.2
item.description: Apple has updated its Aperture software to 3.1.2 - it seems to focus on the new users who quite likely brought the Appstore copy.

item.title: Say hello to 10,000,000,000 little downloads of mobile apps
item.description: It was only earlier this week that Apple's homepage changed to advertise the fact that a 10 billion milestone was soon to be reached.

item.title: Apple Mac App Store initially I was dubious
item.description: Initially I was dubious or even skeptical about the new Apple Mac App Store - and everyone from Mashable to ReadWriteWeb to Download Squad have already done a post about first thoughts or white washed the Apple PR news item.

item.title: Apple Mac App Store an imperfect tool for small apps developers?
item.description: Apple's new Mac App Store arrives on January 6 and it could be the perfect tool for small app developers and a welcome boost in hybrid web-app startups.

item.title: Just installed Office for Mac 2011- first thoughts
item.description: So .. Thanks to Amazon and Royal Mail at 730am I received my copy of Office for Mac 2011.

item.title: iWork - Pages I don't like
item.description: I started the week with the ambition to just use iWork for a week.

item.title: Challenge of the week - Can I get by with iWork alone
item.description: Having cleaned up my Macbook Pro and reformatted the hard drive - I'm going to spend the week using iWork for all my document needs.

item.title: Insert Disc & Press Enter to Format
item.description: Some old habits die hard and so last night I reformatted my 18 month old macbook pro.

item.title: Android Market would benefit Developer instead of Apple App Certification?
item.description: Develop apps for Android or develop mobile apps for Apple, some days its hard to figure out just what to do.

item.title: Could it be Tesco Mobile selling iPhone? or just Tesco Supermarkets
item.description: Sounds like good news in the UK market ‘opening’ up to more distribution channels for the iPhone.

item.title: Does building an iPhone App make cents? sense?
item.description: With the boom in the number of apps in the App Store (over 100,000) and total downloads in excess of 2bn - someone has got to be making money - right?

item.title: MacOSx Converts: XNJB get your Creative audio player to charge on a Mac
item.description: XNJB: is the app of the day for people who have used MP3 players from Creative technology.

item.title: An Apple a Day - more operators to sell iPhone
item.description: Following on yesterday's news that Orange Uk will start selling iPhone - ending O2 / Telefonica's virtual monopoly in the UK.

item.description: The snipping tool has to be one of the best features introduced into Windows Vista (except for the nasty red line around the pictures).

item.title: Upgrading to Virtualbox 3.0 and Mac OSx hosts
item.description: Assuming you have been using Virtualbox before, then the upgrade process to Virtualbox 3 is going to be easy and smooth sailing.

item.title: Blow out the candles - Happy 1st Birthday Apple Apps Store
item.description: So its Happy Birthday to Apple and its App Store - 1 year old.

item.title: Tips on Changing Settings for Virtualbox on a Mac Laptop
item.description: This covers basic settings on a Mac Laptop Intel running osx - Running Virtualbox, the freeware virtualisation software on any computer can be easy - and there are a number of internet based support forums.

item.title: Apple to standardise iTunes prices in Europe
item.description: comment: The reason that Apple charges different retail prices in each market is due to the differences in wholesale prices charged in each market by the major labels.
